nodes.bodyText: Shall we use try resource when creating the FileOutputStream? So that we do not need to close the file explicitly in line 365.
Wrapping an exception with another exception of the same type can be confusing in a stack trace. Better if we can wrap the IOException in another type of exception such as APIMgtException

Shall we throw an exception here instead of returning null? Since we only support either Dynamic or AWS Endpoint type, any other value could lead to a NPE.
Shall we remove this new line ?

The current code uses the Java 7 try with resources pattern which will cause fos to be closed automatically when it goes out of scope. Therefore it does not require to be explicitly closed in a finally block.
